resources.string: You have defied me, human, and I will not forget!
Who dares trespass in the Motherwell? You? How… dare you!
Stop this madness, at once!
We will not suffer on your behalf!
I don't… want… this! Stop me!
The heartgem! Destroy it!
Do it… please! End this!
You have… saved… me. Thank you…
Look who's here! Ah, but you've just missed all the excitement. Extracting a Heartgem is easier than I imagined!
You thought you were getting the edge, but you never had a chance. What little you accomplished, I have taken. Here is your mentor, your friend… or what's left of him. Ha!
Behold, Edengrove.
The jewel of Aeternum!
Here is a land where nature still commands.
It’s thorny,
poisonous,
and beautiful!
You’ll never find in all the world such an abundance of peculiar flora.
Speaking of peculiar,
Did you know the life cycle of the Angry Earth begins in Edengrove?
I’ve been studying them for ages, but always from a distance.
Now, I'm finally to the heart of the matter.
They're key to defeating the Corrupted, I'm sure of it.
There's a druid settlement nearby.
They brokered a shaky truce with the Angry Earth in order to maintain a colony here.
No small feat, that.
The druids will point us to the answers we seek.

string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.comment: All Sun IGC lines for VOX.
string.name: AlchemistSun

resources.string: Behold, Edengrove; the jewel of Aeternum! Here is a land where nature still commands. It’s thorny, poisonous, and beautiful. You’ll never find in all the world such an abundance of peculiar flora. Speaking of peculiar, did you know the life cycle of the Angry Earth begins in Edengrove? I’ve been studying them for ages, but always from a distance. Now, I'm finally to the heart of the matter. They're key to defeating the Corrupted, I'm sure of it. There's a druid settlement nearby. They brokered a shaky truce with the Angry Earth in order to maintain a colony here. No small feat, that. The druids will point us to the answers we seek.

string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.comment: All Galahad IGC lines for VOX.
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: Enough sibling sentimentality! Dammit Myrddin, where is Artorius? What have you done with him? Beg pardon… but the fate of the world takes precedent over a sibling reunion! The king is… within?

string.speaker: Morgaine
string.comment: All Morgaine IGC lines for VOX.
string.name: SorceressMorgain

resources.string: It is me, though I am older, yet you've grown younger instead? And free of the Crimson Sorcerer? Ha… Oh, you tin-plated fool! Can't you put aside your obsessions for even a moment? The king's fate is long past, what matters now is the present.

string.speaker: Myrddin
string.comment: All Myrddin IGC lines for VOX.
string.name: WizardMyrddin

resources.string: Where am I? Is this real? Morgaine… is that you? I… I… Cease this foolish bickering, both of you! Within this prison, time and space blur. I see glimpses of the king. At times, he seems real... Indeed, in truth, my purpose here is to deliver a message to you, Soulwarden.
Where am I? Is this real?
Morgaine… is that you?
It is me, though I am older…
Yet you've grown younger instead?
And free of the Crimson Sorcerer? Ha…
Enough sibling sentimentality!
Dammit Myrddin, where is Artorius?
What have you done with him?
I… I…
Oh, you tin-plated fool! Can't you put aside your obsession for even a moment?
Beg pardon… but the fate of the world takes precedent over a sibling reunion!
Cease this foolish bickering, both of you!
Within this prison, time and space blur.
I see glimpses of the king. At times, he seems real...
The king is… within?
The king's fate is long past, what matters now is the present.
Indeed, in truth…
My purpose here is to deliver a message to you, Soulwarden.

Myrddin's Research Notes on Edengrove, part one\nThe truth of the origins of the Angry Earth eludes me, but evidence indicates they only appeared some time after the Ancients disappeared. Curious.\nPerhaps more importantly, their bonds to the natural world, the true natural world, are complex, and if my theory is correct, there may be some fundamental aspect of the Angry Earth that is related to the insidious influence of Corruption. There is much for me to learn here...
Ah, there we are! Ahem… if you can hear me, come north-northwest, follow the path through the crumbling wall, and into the cave of color. I've left something for you.

Myrddin's Research Notes on Edengrove, part two\nI've discovered the gardens of genesis, a sacred grove here where the Angry Earth seem to be spawned in great number. Perhaps like us, resurrected from some other place? Fascinating.\nThis is not the only sacred location here, however. The dryads guard these massive towers with furious intent. Many secrets must lie hidden within. I must find a way in.

Myrddin's Research Notes on Edengrove, part three
I passed through the Towers surreptitiously and found the knowledge I have long sought, the process of sundering one's soul.
If I'm correct, I may have unlocked the ability to hide away a portion of my soul so that I might risk exposure to Corruption. 
If I'm wrong, then I suppose this is both a letter of goodbye and one of apology for what might ensue. I hope I am not wrong.

Myrddin's Research Notes on Edengrove, part four
I leave this final note for my liege and my sister, the only two with whom I would entrust the sanctity of my soul.
I have hidden here a bastion of my own undoing, a stronghold against time and space, a place where I leave a part of myself for safekeeping.
My soul is dear to my heart, and thus, the keys to veil are those things closest to the hearts of those I love. 
I now step into possibilities of futures I cannot foresee; many of them dark, and though I consign myself to whatever fate my choices lead to, I do this that the small knowledge and insight I have gained can still be reclaimed if the need is dire.
Once again, I find you trespassing on sacred ground, human. I wonder how many times I shall allow this.
Do not try my patience. I have asked you to remove yourself from this sacred mountain, and I will not ask again.

[Adiana] The forests of Edengrove are not places, they are entities in and of themselves, each speaking for its own, but with a shared voice.
Here, the lives of our walking brethren begin in the Garden, but like us, we draw our strength from a deeper well.
All the children are fed by the mother, their sustenance drawn from the river flowing from the one true source.
If a limb becomes infected, it must be severed to protect the source.

[Adiana] Alone but alive, sustenance is needed, but never satiated.
A thirst acquired like a contagion from our enemies, but of the Earth, and now within.
The needs felt are beyond those fitting for life; there is a desire to... spread.
Come closer, others, feel the warmth of our evolved form, a new entity, immune to the enemy, but forever alone... cut off from the well.

[Adiana] A melody emerges from the sounds of the natural world, a song of celebration.. and of lamentation.
The brilliance of new life blooming in the grove, and the dirge sung in memory of those whose sacrifice gave us our purpose.
Rivers within rivers provide the light of our vengeance, our fury, our power.
The childen of the Angry Earth are charges of the Motherwell, the source of our enemies' doom.

Morgaine seems insistent on inspecting those towers, thinks there's some kind of magic in them holding her brother.\n\nGods, why is it always magic? Why not a sword, or a lever, or a simple secret door…

So that did… something? Can never be too certain about how magic works, or doesn't. But it seems we did whatever was expected.\n\nWe should go find out if Morgaine has had any luck in the other tower.
I suppose, however, that the floating tower is revealed, and it beckons to us. \n\nThis could very well be a trap though! Who knows what to expect from the likes of Myrddin's magic?

I have stood on mountaintops and cliffs, looked out over the land and sea... but this is far too unnatural for my taste.\n\nI know I must be here, but I will be happier when my feet are planted firmly on the ground.
Where were you just now? Did you find some way to elude me? I will find out, and it will not happen again!
No! Once again, you take something that is rightfully mine! I am out of patience with this! I'm coming for you, Soulwarden, and MY staff.
No! Once again, you take something that is rightfully mine! I am out of patience with this!
I'm coming for you, Soulwarden, and MY staff.
Oh, you win another victory? A cause for celebration… for you, but perhaps not for everyone.
A pity you cannot see through my eyes. I see banners of blue and gold, and fire. Glorious, beautiful fire.
Oh and now a pity you cannot hear through my ears, the cries of pain, the pleas for mercy… the smashing of Heartgems…
Oh and now a pity you cannot hear through my ears, the cries of pain, the pleas for mercy…
the smashing of Heartgems…
One by one, your allies fall. I wonder, how did it feel, striking down the old man? Perhaps now, you'll begin to listen.
One by one, your allies fall. I wonder, how did it feel, striking down the old man?
Perhaps now, you'll begin to listen.
So different from the Fen… everything here is so alive. Equally deadly, but in a different sort of way.
I have seen this tower… was it in a dream? Or are we dreaming even now?
My mind is racing with a battering of ideas and a plague of emotions. \n\nThere is a way, and I will not leave until I find it!
I have heard the news from Caer Dun, Soulwarden. I am sorry, so very sorry. \n\nWe've all lost… lost too much, I think.
I have a strange feeling about this place, Soulwarden. It's as if Myrddin placed secrets here he intended for me to discover.

Good work in the ruins up there. If the Angry Earth were spawned after the first war with Corruption, they may well hold the secret to defeating it. \n\nI wonder if that's why Myrddin came to this region.
I had forgotten how exhausting it was dealing with my brother. I need to find an inn…
I-I must've dozed off up there, by that swirling maelstrom of chaos that swallowed my brother.\n\nI had a dream in which I was in Caer Dun, only it was burning… it was more of a nightmare, really.
Lost for centuries, no clue to your whereabouts… and now, a path to follow.\n\nI shall find you, brother.

For years, I've looked for clues to Myrddin's fate, and only now do I discover this sanctum? I feel like a fool for not coming here sooner!\n\nThere must be some clue in his words… something about his research into sundering.
My mind is spinning from what we discovered in the crystal sanctum.\n\nI believe Myrddin left something for us, something that could prove very valuable.

If my reasoning is accurate, and it usually is, I believe Myrddin may have unlocked the secret to the ritual of sundering.\n\nIf this is true, and we can find whatever further secrets he left for us, this could change everything.
I knew it! These glyphs are the same as my brother left behind in his workshop. This has to be his handiwork.\n\nWe are close, I can feel it.
There was definitely a change in the energies here, but to what end, I know not.\n\nCome, we must look to the other towers, this cannot be the only piece of the puzzle.
Two keys to unlock this place. Could my brother truly have foreseen this? \n\nIt is fortunate Galahad was here to act the part of Artorius.

I shared our new insights with Morgaine, and of course, she immediately insisted this is proof of her theory about the blight.\n\nBut we must consider the facts as they are, without any preconceived notions.

Exactly, and that is what I will be working on. It seems the sorceress has become distracted with clues about her brother.\n\nHelp Morgaine with her search and then meet me in Caliburne, the elder druids' enclave to the north.
UNUSED - WALKAWAY

At last! How I have looked forward to finding you, Soulwarden! I confirmed the blight we saw in Weaver's Fen can resist Corruption!\n\nBut your allies at Caer Dun - especially that leaf-lover Sun Fuchun - refused to hear me out!
We need to know why the Varangians have come to Edengrove. Go on.

Bah! In crises, caution can be foolish, but I'm willing to humor her. I trust she'll be joining us? Fine.\n\nBefore we proceed, however, I've discovered there are suspicious activities in this region, enemies of a different sort.

Varangians, ruthless raiders who seek to amass all the island's magical artifacts. They often search Myrddin's old haunts.\n\nIf you'll investigate their camp to the south, I'll wait and smooth out Sun's ruffled feathers.

Heh! You'll be glad to know Sun and I have settled our differences, and although my studies will be... slowed somewhat, they will continue.\n\nBut you've returned from the Varangians' camp! Tell me, what did you find?

So my brother was here! I knew he ranged this far north, but I did not know he studied the Angry Earth! This is quite a revelation!\n\nI must take these notes where I can study them more carefully… you should talk to Sun.

The blight has only surfaced in recent years on Aeternum, while clashes between the Angry Earth and Corruption have occurred for centuries.\n\nMost don't even realize that the Stormwall is an expression of the Angry Earth.

Everyone thinks that, but the visible Corruption simply strains against the barrier the Angry Earth manifested to keep it contained.\n\nBut what matters now is that Morgaine, and all of us, proceed with caution.

She rushes ahead on the road to Edengrove, the heart of the Angry Earth's presence on Aeternum.\n\nPlease, catch her and get her to at least hear me out. I'll gather my things, and then join you on the road.

There are countless Ancient Ruins in Edengrove, most of them constructed before the Angry Earth came.\n\nBut the terraces on these roads were built later, possibly even by humans who worshipped the Angry Earth.

Yes, that is likely; there may even be glyphs in the stonework that will give us hints to the Angry Earth's origins.\n\nLet us search, and if you find anything, give a shout, and I will attempt to translate.

Everything I've learned on Aeternum now needs to be reconsidered in this new light.\n\nIf these glyphs are truthful, the Angry Earth literally grew from the bones of dead Ancients… I confess I'm somewhat in shock.

Yes, yes, we must. I caught a glimpse of an encampment down the road by the water. Perhaps Morgaine is there. \n\nWe should head there directly, if for no other reason than to have a safe place to consider what we've learned.
That… that was Myrddin! Quickly, let us follow his instruction!
When time and space are suspended… words from past to future hold the key.
Words are but vessels. Prisons of meaning, where an idea, or a mind can be trapped.
Like the facets of these crystals, mind, heart and soul are just aspects of a singular thing. Take heed, sister.
Like the facets of these crystals, mind, heart and soul are just aspects of a singular thing.
Take heed, sister.

There... his voice again, speaking as if he knew I'd come, and left some riddle… how? What games do you play, brother?\n\nTell me Soulwarden, what did you find in the sanctum that elicited this response?

A pendant? Myrddin never cared for jewelry... wait, this was… it was mine! That bastard of a brother must've stolen it from me. I spent weeks searching!\n\nBah! Can't get distracted, there's more to learn here, I know it!
UNUSED - WALKAWAY

Sometimes secrets are standing right in front of us, and we are oblivious nonetheless. Do you see this stone creag suspended in roots?\n\nWhat does this tell us? The earth gropes after the energy in this stone…

Oh my, that is... a rather outlandish proposition, but based on your earlier discovery, it makes sense. Myrddin must've known this.\n\nLook for samples of the veined stone that might be mined. Whatever's inside, we need it.
This. This was constructed by Myrddin! I can almost smell the redolence of herbs he carried in his robes! It is uncanny!\n\nIt's like he wanted me to find this device - it must serve some purpose!

What do you think I've been doing here? Just humming a melody? The blasted thing is lacking an energy source.\n\nJust the kind of absurdity my brother so enjoyed… wait, but try using the crystals from the veined stones!

I can't believe my ears! I heard Myrddin's voice... like he was right beside me! You heard it too!\n\nThis is the place! A cavern of crystals, emanating a power unlike any I've seen, even here on Aeternum.

Yes, we must! But those damned Varangian raiders are already rummaging about… who knows how much they've already spoiled?!\n\nDestroy them, and carve a path for us to reach Myrddin's sanctum. We're so close now!
Go on then, deposit the crystals, activate Myrddin's infernal machine!

Eventually, yes, but he spent many years before that seeking answers about how he might study it, without falling under its influence.\n\nMy brother kept many secrets, and I believe some of them are hidden here in Edengrove.

Yes, my bond with my brother was strong, especially being scarred in our final encounter, and I can almost sense his presence… hovering above us?\n\nCome, let us ascend to greater heights to... get a better view.

Now, I think we've finally found something useful. The whispers spoke of the source, from where the Angry Earth's lifeforce is drawn.\n\nIf there is power to fight the Corruption, it is guarded within this Motherwell.

I'm not sure, but the scrolls in Caliburne spoke of something similar, a hidden basin sacred to the Angry Earth.\n\nThe waters of this region are collected there, and if this is true, that might be the key to finding it.
Meet with Sun and let her know what we have found. \n\nHer focus is on the Angry Earth, but mine is on my brother, as it should be.
Myrddin was obsessed with the Ancients' methods of sundering the souls of their guardians.\n\nHe hoped it could allow him to study Corruption, protecting his soul from falling under its influence.

Similar, but the Soulwardens only emerged after Myrddin became the Crimson Sorcerer… he knew them only as enemies.\n\nHmm. This is going to take time, young one. I must study every detail of this chamber.

Ah, yes! Tell her what we found. Although she'll want to see this, and… no, that's not good. Not yet.\n\nI need time, Soulwarden. You and Sun can get on with studying the Angry Earth. I'll join you in Caliburne soon.

Not many records of the elder druids here, but I did find clues as to how they kept peace with the Angry Earth.\n\nBut what about you? I know Morgaine felt strongly that her brother came here… did you find any signs of him?

That explains her absence, and it's welcome news! We can delve deeper into the Angry Earth's relationship to Corruption.\n\nI'm curious about these druidic rituals used to commune with what they called "the forest spirit."

Great idea! The elder druids brought offerings to shrines in the woods to make contact.\n\nWe will need to extract samples from dryads or other Angry Earth. Let's collect as many as we can and meet in the mangroves. Good luck.
It's amazing. This mangrove swamp is teeming with the life force of the Angry Earth!\n\nThey are stronger here, more resilient, and quicker to resurrect. Their power is bound to the land here.

A plant's hardiness is determined by the dirt encasing its roots, and so do these dryads and other life forms thrive here.\n\nBut let us proceed. Search for these "shrines" and offer up the samples… then let's see what happens.

Well, either my sanity is finally slipping, or the ritual worked! I heard a voice, speaking… something about a garden and severing infected limbs.\n\nI wonder if that's a reference to the Blight in the nearby ruins.

I don't know. Perhaps we collect samples from the creatures who've become Blighted? Yes, and then seek out another shrine.\n\nIt's worth a try at least. I wonder if there are shrines even in the midst of this? Let's find out.

There! I heard it too, but different than before, weaker, alone and very confused.\n\nIt would seem the Blighted Angry Earth are cut off from the power that sustains them. That is the power we need to fight Corruption.

Yes, perhaps here in this eastern grove, where the Blight has not encroached and the forest remains pure.\n\nLet's collect more healthy samples and search for another of those shrines we might commune with.

Ah, Soulwarden, I've been waiting for your return! There is an incredible power hidden within the Ancient Towers here. \n\nAlmost everything in Myrddin's sanctum suggests he found something there… or left it for us to find.

This is about the Angry Earth, yes? Make no mistake - I am interested, but it will have to wait.\n\nMyrddin's clues strongly assert time is critical in solving his riddles, and the answers are hidden in these towers.
To think this could all be as simple as tracking the flow of azoth. Let us hope!

Ah, wait, but this is clearly not just the waters of this region, but rather the azoth that is undoubtedly bound to it.\n\nWe need some device with which we read the flow of azoth to triangulate the position of the Motherwell.

Of course! Brilliant! It's almost as if fate has guided us here, equipped for this very purpose.\n\nLet us search the groves for places where azoth has collected, and then use your staff to trace the flow of power.
This looks promising! An upsurge from deep underground, certainly a pocket of azoth, seeking to find its way to the source.\n\nI suspect this what the whispers meant by rivers within rivers.
Place your Azoth Staff in the water and step back. If this works, the staff should move in some way and point us in the general direction of the Motherwell.\n\nThat's my theory, at least.

Well, that was an adventure! We trekked across half of Edengrove. Let's just hope this helps to pinpoint the location of the Motherwell.\n\nI took note of each direction your staff indicated. Now I just need time with a map.

Then we follow the flow of azoth, and find out for ourselves if this Motherwell still exists.\n\nWe should inform Morgaine of what we've learned, if you'll find her, I'll figure out all the mapping parts.
Well done, my liege! I hope your shield has protected you as well it has allowed for my protection in this instance. I will see you soon.
Well done, my liege!
I hope your shield has protected you as well it has allowed for my protection in this instance.
I will see you soon.
Well sister, now you know why I stole your pendant. Let us hope that was for the cause of seeing us soon reunited.
Well sister, now you know why I stole your pendant.
Let us hope that was for the cause of seeing us soon reunited.

I can't believe it! That was not there a moment ago! That wizard floated a tower into the sky, then made it invisible!\n\nGod's teeth! Such powers should not be possible. I don't even know what to say.

Greetings, Soulwarden. You seem as surprised as I am to find me here. Morgaine promises we are close to learning Myrddin's secrets.\n\nIf any light can be shed on the fate of the High King, I am willing to take the chance.

That would be a worthy outcome as well, but you should know the damned wizard's riddles are notoriously difficult.\n\nAll the same, let us venture into these towers and learn whatever we can. Lead on, Soulwarden.
This is… quite unsettling. The shield of my lord king in such a state, is this meant to disturb me? Or is this Myrddin's riddle?\n\nI'm sorry, Soulwarden. I'm afraid I'm at a loss.
You mean… yes, of course! Artorius's shield was indeed held over his heart! \n\nLet us try this and find if it might be the solution to Myrddin's puzzle.
Myrddin definitely hinted that time was a critical component here, so let's not waste it.
Did you read the notes, Soulwarden? My brother…. I do not think he has hidden some item away or some small scrap of knowledge. \n\nCould it be that some part of him still lives?

Yes, let us solve this riddle, whatever it may bring. This looks similar to the Ancient prison device in the Fen, but Myrddin must've changed it.\n\nIt would seem to require the insertion of some item, something small.
Of course! That's exactly the kind of riddle my brother so enjoyed…. It's the pendant. That's why he took it!\n\nQuickly, here, take the pendant and let's see if it works!

Precisely! My brother - fiendish bastard that he could be - was also a scholar of unrivaled insight.\n\nHe spent DECADES studying Corruption, and he hid his greatest discovery here… undoubtedly obscured by magical veils.

Yes, Myrddin was quite fond of such tricks, like hiding my personal affects when I turned my back.\n\nUnveiling what he's hidden requires solving his riddles. Heh, Artorius and I would spend days wracking our minds.

A combination of the clues from the sanctum, and whatever's in these towers.\n\nYou'll be surprised to hear I've even invited Galahad in case his memories can help. Speak with him, and then we'll visit these towers.
It's about time! You were gone so long, I came to search and then I saw that floating tower appear in the sky! \n\nThis has something to do with Myrddin, doesn't it?
He… what? I'm sorry, I must've misunderstood. You met the Crimson Sorcerer?\n\nI had always heard he was a force of destruction, but here you stand! What kind of warning did he pass to you?

The Staff of Wizardry… Myrddin's staff? I have only a passing knowledge of that history, but I have heard the stories of this staff.\n\nAfter it became Corrupted, it is said the Crimson Sorcerer laid waste to entire villages.

Though it is just the faintest thread of hope, it is my only chance of finding Artorius on this infernal island.\n\nI must thank you. Traveling with you has renewed my dream, but from here, I must walk a different path.

I am. Fare thee well, my friend. I could not have wished for a finer companion.\n\nI deeply regret I will not be at your side for the rest of your journey, but it is my first and foremost duty to find my lord king.
So it is. I pray that we cross paths once again, Soulwarden.\n\nAnd when we do, I will rejoice in presenting you to my liege so he may honor and reward you for your service. Until then, Godspeed!
UNUSED - WALKAWAY

Amazing! Yes, I recognize this tower from Myrddin's drawings and diagrams. He always aspired to build such a structure.\n\nHow strange it is to think it has been hidden here all along, and he may even be inside.

Honestly, I don't know. I have so many questions to ask, and the knowledge he has could turn the tide in the battle against Corruption.\n\nWe stand at the precipice of too many possibilities to consider. Let us go forward.

That damned fool knight! To lock himself in purgatory, and for what? The chance to glimpse Artorius again? Bah!\n\nMy brother is the tragic figure here! We hardly exchanged words before he was yanked back into oblivion!

He may have accepted his fate, but that doesn't mean I have to! The fact he appeared at all proves there is some mechanism at work!\n\nI will liberate you from this madness, brother! I will not sleep until I do!

Yes! Crisis upon crisis, they stack up by the hour! But I will not abandon my brother so easily this time!\n\nNo, you'll have to ask Sun about these mines Myrddin referred to. Perhaps the elder druids knew of them. I will remain here.

My time is limited, so I'll be brief. Imprisoning myself here was the only way I could end the war and save my sister.\n\nBut the Tempest is now poised to finish what I started when I was the Crimson Sorcerer.

I am stuck here, but I offer this - the Staff of Wizardry, my staff, became Corrupted and was buried deep in the mines south of here.\n\nEven now, the Tempest seeks to reclaim it, and with it, all my power. You cannot allow this.

There are too many possibilities. I'm sorry to tell you, most of them do not end well, but listen to my sister. She's wiser than me anyhow.\n\nThe only thing I can tell you with confidence is to get that staff, and quickly.

The staff is a mighty artifact, beyond any other I ever made… and I made many. \n\nYou could cleanse it of Corruption, but that would take a source of immense power. I don't know. I… cannot remain here any longer.

I have a temporal reprieve, one for which I sacrificed much. I may not get another.\n\nI must go. I sense Galahad wishes to follow. A foolish gesture, but I cannot stop him. Good luck, Soulwarden. I hope we meet again somehow.

Every instinct screams that I should stay, but what kind of knight would balk at danger when so much is at stake?\n\nIf Myrddin is in there, I have questions, and he will answer or feel the sting of my blade!
Very well, Soulwarden. I'll follow your lead. If it is the wizard himself, I have never relished conversing with the man. \n\nBut I must know what became of my lord king.

As usual, I find you walking away from a ruckus barely scathed. I thought my skills in healing might be of use, but I'm glad they're not.\n\nYou found the Corrupted Staff of Wizardry, did you? Yes, I sense it weighing on you.
Let me pack up here, I'll head out shortly. You have more than enough to deal with than to wait around for me.

That would be Annwn Deep... and that would explain the Corrupted massing that area! \n\nIf the Tempest already knows the staff's location, then there's not a moment to spare. You must go to Annwn and do whatever it takes to find it first.

I would be a hindrance in any battle, let alone one against the Corrupted. I will find a safe place in view of the mine and await you.\n\nThe map indicates the Motherwell is near there, so I will search around and see what I can find.

I saw you coming from afar, human, and I sensed the foul air of Corruption that accompanies you.\n\nI know you bear the headpiece of the Magus's staff and I want nothing to do with it. I thought you were smarter than this.

Oh… ? Is this why your polite friend visited previously and asked about the Motherwell?\n\nYou would seek my blessing to tap into the Angry Earth's most sacred source of power to cleanse a Wizard's bauble?

That is your problem, human, not ours. I told you before - the Angry Earth has sacrificed enough against the Crimson Menace.\n\nAllowing a corrupted Artifact into the Motherwell would infect it with Blight. I will never permit that.

See now, here again, another tactic I've seen from humanity more times than I can count!\n\nYou impose on nature again and again, and then when confronted, you plead ignorance. Begone, human. I have no more to say to you.

I only heard snippets that carried on the wind, but it was enough to know our request was not granted. \n\nMy mind is churning with backup plans, something, anything the elder druids might have written about.

Then we may be done for. We could perhaps shelter here, but the Huntress has forbidden us that reprieve as well. \n\nI have to just say it, I sympathize with the Angry Earth, but that woman, she is cruel!
Cleanse it? But what could possibly have the capability to cleanse such a powerful artifact? \n\nOh, well of course… you're probably thinking what I'm thinking. The Motherwell.

Yes. I have discovered that the summit of this mountain is sacred to the Angry Earth, and I believe the entrance to the Motherwell is there.\n\nBut that is not all. The voice who speaks for the Angry Earth, she is there.

Then you know of her? I had heard rumors, but never encountered her until now. She has a strange aura, and a cold demeanor.\n\nI sense however that she is the one who can give us permission to visit the Motherwell.

Then I think that would be wise. We could attempt to get access to the Motherwell without her blessing, but it will be much better this way.\n\nLet's go then. I'll show you to the place where the Huntress resides.

I was skeptical of the claims of the elder druids, but they knew of this place. The Silent Summit they called it. It is where the Forest Spirit resides. \n\nTheir promises to the Angry Earth forbade them from coming here.

Her voice is the same as that we heard at the Forest Shrines and the legends of the Huntress go far back.\n\nSo yes, I think it's quite likely that she is the same one, and that makes me nervous. Good luck.

Soulwarden? Are you here, or am I dreaming? I think I may have spent too much time at Myrddin's tower. Everything is… murky.\n\nTell me, were you able to get the Staff of Wizardry before the Tempest did?
Well, how perfect is that? Let me see here... I can take your azoth staff, and imbue it like so... there you go!\n\nNow, what were we talking about? Were we talking about dreams?
UNUSED - WALKAWAY

Wait, are you seriously considering this? The Huntress warned that the staff would infect the Motherwell with Blight. I don't know how bad that may be, but would that be worth keeping the staff from the Tempest? \n\nStill, I can't say what's right here. I trust your judgment.

Alright, at the risk of incurring her wrath, I will approach her and ask for her blessing again in order to provide a distraction.\n\nThe entrance is over there. If we survive, we meet back at camp. Good luck... to us both.
There you are! I've been watching so long my eyes are hurting.\n\nBut where is Yonas? Did you find him? I-I don't understand.
No… not Yonas. I-I don't understand… these heartgems were supposed to protect us from Corruption!\n\nHow did this happen? Was it all a lie?
I will be fine. You should go to Caer Dun… as quickly as possible!

Really? Then what are you waiting for? You should go, before it is too late!\n\nI cannot see straight, let alone go into battle, but I will try and find you when I can. Make haste to Caer Dun, Soulwarden!
Where… where were you? The attack, it came on so quickly. The whole place was burning, and Corrupted everywhere!\n\nThey tore out our Heartgems and smashed them… and then… Yonas.
She… I mean that thing, that demon dragged him off towards the north gate.\n\nLet's go quickly… perhaps there is still time.
He-he saved me you see, and then he was knocked down, but there wasn't anything I could do… \n\nThey have taken our fearless leader captive, and with him, my hope.
I think they went west… I think, but I do not know. \n\nAfter I saw the darkness in her eyes, everything is very foggy in my memory… go after him, after Yonas, if you can. Please!

Hail, Warden! Are you the vanguard of our reinforcements? I'd expected to see Yonas crossing the mountains at the front of a great force, but you are the only one we've seen.\n\nHow long until the army arrives?
Hearing that Yonas has fallen… that is a blow. His loss will be felt for quite some time.\n\nAnd without reinforcements on the way, we may be forced to abandon this position.
We will do what we can here, then we will come north. There is nowhere else to go.
Yes, and even further, behind the lines in Shattered Mountain, but they were barely holding their positions. Yonas planned to send reinforcements.\n\nBut now, there is no one to send.

Then you should. There is nothing left here, very little to even salvage. If our cause has any chance at all, it is in assaulting the Shattered Mountain. \n\nGo. Whatever shred of hope remains in my heart goes with you.

The sorceress spent a few weeks studying the blight in Weaver's Fen, and she's now certain it can be used as a weapon against the Corrupted.\n\nI have spent decades among the Angry Earth, and I'm skeptical of her reasoning.
If the Blighted Angry Earth are cut off from their source of power, I fear there is no method of using the blight to battle Corruption.

The energy that sustains the Angry Earth flows through the waters here... what could be more natural?\n\nWe find the Motherwell where all the waters of Edengrove flow, and we find a source of immense power.
Now I want an azoth staff of my own. I might have to reconsider your invitation to become a Soulwarden.
Well, it gave us a direction to travel in, at least! I suppose this could be a wild turkey chase, but what if it isn't?
So far the staff has pointed south each time, but there is a lot of ground in that direction.\n\n Perhaps we need to find the location where all these lines intersect.
The question now is what to do with this infernal artifact. It must be destroyed, but how?\n\nTell me it doesn't need to be cast into the fires of the Shattered Mountain.
This is it. This is where I spoke with the Huntress, but I'm not sure you're ready yet.

We come here asking for help to battle a threat that would consume all Aeternum, and she can't be bothered!\n\nIt's tempting to defy her entirely and take our chances in Motherwell without her blessing.
We are too late returning home… I see Yash. Is there anyone else? Anyone?
We must leave. There is nothing for us here. I suppose I should return to Ebonscale Reach.\n\nYou are welcome to come with me, Soulwarden.
Well, it seems you've found something to capture Morgaine's attention. \n\nThat's good because I should like to share with you more about this wondrous place we venture into. Please, follow me…
I would like to continue on to the druidic enclave as soon as we get our bearings.
There's something to this. If I'm not mistaken, this is all pointing towards the mountains to the south.\n\nThough the exact location we still need to figure out.

If there is some danger of the Tempest acquiring that power, then the Motherwell will have to wait.\n\nIf the staff has not been reclaimed, does that mean it's hidden somewhere? That we might find it first?
We did it. I can't believe we did it, but we did. The Huntress will be furious in ways I fear will come back to haunt us.
The elder druids who founded this settlement are mostly gone… along with whatever secrets they knew about the Angry Earth.
I am skeptical that the elder druids really communed with any 'forest spirits,' more likely they were a little addled.\n\nWe will see soon enough.
One step, one fragment of knowledge, leads to another. \n\nGrowth comes in fits and starts, and so does our comprehension of these elemental creatures.
What do we do now…? What if… what if she comes back?
I am sorry, I know I should pull myself together. Perhaps I just need time. So many Wardens lost.\n\nI wonder how those fare who remain in the north, at the outposts we established.
[Adiana] The forests of Edengrove are not places, they are entities in and of themselves,
[Adiana] each speaking for its own, but with a shared voice.
[Adiana] Here, the lives of our walking brethren begin in the Garden,
[Adiana] but like us, we draw our strength from a deeper well.
[Adiana] All the children are fed by the mother,
[Adiana] their sustenance drawn from the river flowing from the one true source.
[Adiana] If a limb becomes infected, it must be severed to protect the source.
[Adiana] Alone but alive, sustenance is needed, but never satiated.
[Adiana] A thirst acquired like a contagion from our enemies, but of the Earth, and now within.
[Adiana] The needs felt are beyond those fitting for life; there is a desire to... spread.
[Adiana] Come closer, others, feel the warmth of our evolved form,
[Adiana] a new entity, immune to the enemy, but forever alone... cut off from the well.
[Adiana] A melody emerges from the sounds of the natural world, a song of celebration.. and of lamentation.
[Adiana] The brilliance of new life blooming in the grove,
[Adiana] and the dirge sung in memory of those whose sacrifice gave us our purpose.
[Adiana] Rivers within rivers provide the light of our vengeance, our fury, our power.
[Adiana] The children of the Angry Earth are charges of the Motherwell, the source of our enemies' doom.
Talk to {destinationName}

It was with great hesitation that I departed from Caer Dun during a time of such critical preparation.\n\nI can only hope Morgaine's theories lead us to something of tremendous value to assist in our efforts.
I'm no enchanter, but these designs do remind me of the gewgaws I saw in Myrddin's workshop centuries ago.\n\nPerhaps there's some truth to Morgaine's theory.

Two Ancients, on opposite sides of a conflict.

Three towers, surrounded by trees and floating rocks. Edengrove?

After a successful offensive in Great Cleave, the focus now turns to a more permanent solution for Corruption.\nTravel into Edengrove with Sun and Morgaine to search for knowledge, weapons, or allies that may help in the battle ahead.
The Untamed Garden
"I thought the Stormwall was Corrupted."
"Where is Morgaine now?"

"She's already gone on ahead. Again."
"We could find useful clues here."
"We should share this with Morgaine."

Inspect the pendant

"We should activate it and find out."
"We should go in and investigate."

"We should look for this well of power."

Morgaine believes that Myrddin has hidden vital secrets away somewhere within Edengrove - and has a hunch that the towers around the crater may hold the key to finding them.\n\nTravel with her to the towers and investigate her theory.

"We need to pierce these veils?"
"What riddles do we need to solve now?"
"This could help us fight Corruption?"

"Even if we prevent that, how do we defeat her?"

"Why do you have to leave?"

Unlocking the strange devices in the towers of Edengrove revealed a tower floating above the crater, which Morgaine believes to be Myrddin's prison.\nInvestigate this strange area with Morgaine and Galahad.
Myrddin's Fate
Approach the tower
"Alright… maybe let's hear him out."
"You don't have to come."

At Myrddin's urging, the hunt begins for the headpiece of his Staff of Wizardry, a relic that could shift the balance of power in the fight against Corruption.\n\nTravel to the southern mines of Edengrove and locate the headpiece of the Staff.
The Staff of Wizardry
Examine the pick marks on the walls
The pick marks on the wall look a few weeks old.
Investigate the discarded tools
These tools were discarded some time ago.
"What will you do?"

"It's buried in the mines to the south."
Retrieve the headpiece of Myrddin's Staff

"We need to cleanse the staff."
"We have to prevent the Tempest from using its power."
"Then tell me what to do?"
"The Tempest is coming. We must hurry."

Continue searching for the Speaker
This area seems to face the ruins above.
"Maybe. Did you find the location of it?"
"Adiana? The Huntress?"
"I can speak to her."
"We might be able to cleanse it."
"You think Adiana was here, then too?
Enter the ruins and meet the Speaker
"Yes, I have the headpiece here, cleansed."

Morgaine's dream and Isabella's whispering tells of an attack on the Soulwarden fortress of Caer Dun.\n\nHurry to Caer Dun and investigate.
A Shadow Falls
Return to {POITags} and tell Yash of Yonas's fate
"I think it may actually have been attacked."
Follow Yash to the gates
"Yes, I need to find Yonas. Where is he?"
"There's still hope. Which way did they go?"
"Yonas has fallen. There are no more reinforcements."
With the fortress of Caer Dun in shambles, plans against the forces of Corruption have stalled.\n\nTravel to Shattered Mountain and give the terrible news to Warden Yseult.
To Shattered Mountain
"I can go."
"In Great Cleave?"
xxxxxx
Behold, Edengrove, the jewel of Aeternum!
Here is a land where nature still commands. It’s thorny, poisonous, and beautiful,
and you’ll never find in all the world such an abundance of peculiar flora.
Speaking of peculiar, did you know the life cycle of the Angry Earth begins in Edengrove?
I’ve been studying them for ages, but always from a distance.
It seems now we must study them ever more closely.
There is an enclave founded by the elder druids to the north; we will have to visit there…
they undoubtedly hoard some of the knowledge we seek...
XXXXX
I think we're now agreed on continuing Morgaine's research, but with caution. \n\nI hope this new collaborative spirit is here to stay.
We need to get these fires out, then find Yonas! Help me, please!
